Detailed Description

A player which implements the tit-for-tat strategy.

A built-in version of the common (and, by all accounts, maximal) tit-for-tat strategy. This player leads with the cooperate move, and thereafter simply duplicates the last move which its opponent chose.

Member Function Documentation

virtual Player* TitForTatPlayer::Clone (  )  const [virtual]

Create a newly allocated copy of the current player.

To properly implement an "add player" event (wxEVT_ADD_PLAYER), we need to be able to create an arbitrary copy of a given player, without knowing its type at runtime. This method returns an exact duplicate of the current object, and is simply implemented as return new [Type](*this);.

Implements Player.

Reimplemented from Player.

bool TitForTatPlayer::Think ( const Game *  gamePlayed,
const Player *  nextOpponent 
) [virtual]

Determine the next game move.

This function sets nextMove based upon some function of pastGames[&nextOpponent].

Note:
The behavior of the Think function should not depend on anything but the identity (i.e. address) of nextOpponent -- in particular, cheating (reading the value of nextOpponent->nextMove, that is) will do you no good, because you have no guarantee whether or not nextOpponent has had its Think function called already.
Parameters:
gamePlayed The game currently being played
nextOpponent The opponent which is currently being played

Implements Player.
